Question: In 1768, this person began construction of his primary residence, Monticello, on a hilltop overlooking a 5,000 acre plantation.
Hints: Over the next seventeen days, this person had limited time for writing and finished the draft quickly.
This person was the principal designer of the University grounds.
Still in his 40s, this person was minister to France from 1785 to 1789, the year the French Revolution started.
